questions.question: Which sentence correctly uses a mixed conditional (past condition + present result)?
options: If I had taken the job offer, I would be living in Paris today.
If I take the job offer, I will live in Paris.
If I took the job offer, I would live in Paris.
If I had taken the job offer, I would have lived in Paris.
questions.answer: If I had taken the job offer, I would be living in Paris today.

questions.question: Complete the mixed conditional: 'If they _____ (not eat) all the pizza last night, we _____ (have) some for lunch now.'
Identify the mixed conditional sentence:
options: If you heat ice, it melts.
If she had practiced more, she would have won the competition.
If I were you, I would apologize.
If you had listened to me, you wouldn't be in trouble now.
questions.answer: If you had listened to me, you wouldn't be in trouble now.
